abstract: Mohamed Rafik Naji, Brooklyn man who tried to join Islamic State in 2015 and told informer of terrorist group's plan to attack Times Square, is arrested and charged with attempting to provide material support to terrorists.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Mohamed Rafik Naji told an informer that ISIS wanted to stage an attack in Times Square similar to the one that killed 86 people in Nice, France, the authorities said.
snippet: Mohamed Rafik Naji told an informer that ISIS wanted to stage an attack in Times Square similar to the one that killed 86 people in Nice, France, the authorities said....

headline.main: Brooklyn Man Arrested, Accused of Supporting Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Man Backed ISIS and Talked  of Times Sq. Attack, Authorities Allege
